text:
Does anyone know how to get a projection matrix out of LowRankModels output?
Low rank models does the whole PCA via mimimize  `||A - X'Y||`  thing
and then tells you `X` and `Y`
so if i PCA from 5 down to 3 I should have a 5x3 projection matrix `P`  that would project up/down into the 3 dimentional space.
such that `P * P' * A  = Y'X ≈ A`
(This `P` is what MultivariateStats gives it is it’s `proj` field; and is what i expect PCA to look like in general).
I am trying to workout how to derive `P` from `X` and `Y`
<@U677NAWV8> thought the answer was `qr(Y).Q` but that has size 3x3

text:
```A is 5x50 (nfeature x nobs)
P is 5x3  (nfeatures x nlatent)
X is 3x5 (nlatent x nfeatures)
Y is 3x50 (nlatent x nobs) ```

P is 5x3  (nfeatures x nlatent)
X is 3x5 (nlatent x nfeatures)
Y is 3x50 (nlatent x nobs)

text:
>  But in any case if you want P P’ X to be about X, you need P to be qr of X instead of Y
Why do I want `P P' X to be about X` ?

elements.text: But in any case if you want P P’ X to be about X, you need P to be qr of X instead of Y
P P' X to be about X

text: In the conventions in which I'm not confused, you have A tall and skinny and you want A - X Y' to be small. X = QQ' X where Q, of the same shape as X, is an orthogonal basis for the range of X, aka qr(X). Q
